asw_1: Nicht auf dem eigenen Recht bestehen
info:
Participation in road traffic requires constant caution and mutual respect. Therefore, defensive drivers expect other road users to make mistakes.

In addition, defensive drivers are prepared not to insist on their rights in order to resolve dangerous situations.
text: Was versteht man unter defensivem Fahren?

info:
Inattentiveness leads to reactions of other road users being recognized late or not at all. A lack of space between cars shortens the time available to react to the behaviour of the vehicle in front of you.

As a rule, the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you must be such that it can be retained even if the vehicle in front of you brakes suddenly.

If you are driving in front of other vehicles you must not brake hard without a compelling reason.
text: Was kann zu Auffahrunfällen führen?

asw_2: - betätigt den Blinker vor dem Abbiegen zu spät
asw_3: - hält unerwartet an, um nach dem Weg zu fragen
info:
Due to the fact that the number plate is not local, it cannot be ruled out that the driver of the vehicle with the non-local number plate may not have any local knowledge and as a result may make unexpected decisions.

It is possible that the driver of the vehicle with the non-local number plate will brake unexpectedly. He or she could be very late in activating the direction indicators. The vehicle could also stop unexpectedly.
text: Sie fahren innerorts hinter einem Fahrzeug mit ortsfremdem Kennzeichen. Was könnte geschehen?

info:
Anyone taking part in traffic must behave in such a way that no one else is harmed, endangered or harassed unnecessarily under the circumstances.

Motor vehicles must not drive so slowly that they impede the flow of traffic without good reason. A fuel shortage can be avoided by regularly checking the tank level.

Stalling the engine can be avoided by practicing starting.
text: Was sind vermeidbare Behinderungen im fließenden Verkehr?

asw_2: Weil die Gefahr von Auffahrunfällen erhöht wird
asw_3: Weil Nachfolgende zu gefährlichem Überholen verleitet werden
info: Motor vehicles must not drive so slowly that they impede the flow of traffic without good reason. Slow driving increases the risk of rear-end collisions. In addition, it can tempt the driver of the vehicle behind you to overtake your vehicle.
text: Warum darf man nicht unnötig langsam fahren?

info: Both heavy eyelids and frequent yawning are typical signs of fatigue. As a result of fatigue, the ability to react can be impaired, increasing the risk of accidents.
text: Welche Anzeichen warnen während der Fahrt vor aufkommender Müdigkeit?

info:
There are many ways in which fatigue has a negative effect on the driver. There is a danger that he or she will fall asleep for a few seconds and thus lose control of his or her vehicle.

There is also a risk of a lack of concentration, which can lead to driving errors.
text: Welche Folgen kann die Missachtung von Müdigkeitsanzeichen nach sich ziehen?

info: Taking breaks help the body to regenerate and can thus help combat fatigue. Exercise in fresh air stimulates the circulation and activates vital functions.
text: Was ist zu tun, wenn Sie während der Fahrt Anzeichen von Müdigkeit spüren?

info: Fatigue can affect the driver in many ways. There is a risk of dwindling attention, limited perception of traffic events and delayed reactions.
text: Wie wirkt sich Müdigkeit beim Fahren aus?

info:
Whether the speed is too high or too low, in both cases there is a risk of dangerous traffic situations. For example, a low speed can motivate other motorists to overtake your vehicle in a dangerous manner.

Driving at too high a speed presents dangers such as leaving too little time to detect dangerous situations.

Depending on their position, vehicles at a standstill are only recognised by other motorists at a late stage, which can lead to collisions or dangerous evasive manoeuvres.
text: Wodurch kann eine gefährliche Situation entstehen?

info:
Both distraction and inattention result in inadequate observation of the road and the traffic situation, presenting the threat of veering off the road. Fatigue presents the same danger.

Perception and reaction can be restricted, and there is also the threat of nodding off for a moment.
text: Was kann zum Abkommen von der Fahrbahn führen?

They could also start running at the first sign of a change of traffic light. It is also possible that children may push each other into the road.

As soon as a cycle path ends, there is always a risk that cyclists will move onto the road without interruption and continue their journey.

Scheduled buses and marked school buses stopped at bus stops with hazard warning lights turned on may only be overtaken at walking speed and at such a distance that passengers are not endangered.

Walking speed also applies to oncoming traffic on the same road. Bus passengers must not be obstructed. If necessary, anyone driving a vehicle must wait.

text: Die Straßenbahn ist an der Haltestelle gerade zum Stehen gekommen. Welches Verhalten ist richtig?

info:
Agricultural machinery can discharge soil, clay and other dirt particles onto the roadway, which is why there is an increased risk of slipping at the junctions of dirt roads.

The same applies to junctions of construction sites. There is a risk of pollution from construction site traffic.
text: Wo müssen Sie besonders mit starker Fahrbahnverschmutzung und Rutschgefahr rechnen?

info:
Moisture increases the risk of road traffic accidents in many ways. Vehicles in front can splash water, which impairs visibility.

The moisture between the road surface and the tyres reduces the grip of the tyres, which results in a longer braking distance.
text: Warum müssen Sie bei Nässe einen erheblich größeren Sicherheitsabstand einhalten als bei trockener Fahrbahn?

asw_2: Auf Strecken, die durch Wald führen
info:
Wind and a lack of subsoil cause the road surface on bridges to cool down more quickly, threatening earlier icing of the road.

The same applies to forests, where humidity is often higher and less or no direct sunlight reaches the roadway.
text: Wo müssen Sie besonders mit Fahrbahnvereisung rechnen?

asw_1: Weil die Fahrbahnoberfläche uneben und unterschiedlich griffig ist
asw_3: Weil das Fahren auf den Schienen gefährlich ist
info:
Different road surfaces can have different grip and thus influence the driving stability. Especially on tracks, there is a risk of poorer traction. Cyclists must be particularly careful when crossing the tracks so that they do not lose traction.

At the same time, the tracks mean that a tram can appear from either direction at any time. In particular, motorists about to turn left must keep a close eye on rail traffic.
text: Warum müssen Sie auf dieser Straße besonders aufmerksam fahren?

info:
On icy road sections, grip is reduced. Steering movements, braking and acceleration threaten the driving stability of the vehicle.

As soon as the road surface is no longer icy, such interventions can have an abrupt effect and thus significantly change the behaviour of the vehicle.
text: Die Straße ist auf einem kurzen Stück vereist. Was sollen Sie hier möglichst vermeiden?

info:
If a road is suspected to be icy, a test should always be carried out with extreme caution to prevent the vehicle from swerving or skidding.

For this purpose, it is possible to brake in a controlled manner at a slow speed after looking into the rear-view mirror.
text: Wie können Sie beim Fahren gefahrlos feststellen, ob die Fahrbahn vereist ist?

asw_2: Weil die Sicht durch die Kurve behindert ist
asw_3: Weil die Fahrbahn durch den falsch parkenden Pkw verengt ist
info:
The incorrectly parked car makes it difficult to see into and around the bend. In addition, it requires a lane change while driving through a narrow lane at the same time.

The snow provides less grip, which makes steering more difficult and increases braking distance.
text: Warum müssen Sie hier besonders vorsichtig fahren?

info: The sudden appearance of fog is possible almost everywhere. But in places near bodies of water, such as rivers, moors and lakes, the probability for fog to appear is particularly high.
text: Wo müssen Sie besonders mit plötzlich auftretendem Nebel rechnen?

info:
In difficult visibility conditions, sources of danger are identified later than in normal visibility conditions. It is thus necessary to reduce your speed in order to adapt to the new visibility conditions.

If visibility due to fog, snow or rain is less than 50 m, the speed must not exceed 50 km/h unless a lower speed is required. Your vehicle may only be driven at such a speed that it can be stopped within a clear distance.

The distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you should be adjusted so that your vehicle can stop in time.
text: Was müssen Sie tun, wenn vor Ihnen ein Nebelfeld die Sicht stark behindert?

asw_3: Weil der Gegenverkehr die Kurve schneiden könnte
info:
The combination of curve and dense vegetation at the edge of the road makes the course of the road unclear. At the same time, the bend is elongated, which increases the risk of oncoming traffic driving in the middle.

Cobblestones and repaired areas form an uneven road surface, which has different effects on the grip of the tyres.
text: Warum müssen Sie hier besonders aufmerksam sein?

info: When oncoming traffic is dazzling, do not look directly into the headlights, but turn away your gaze and look as far as possible to the right side of the road. To reduce the risk of a collision due to dazzling traffic, reduce your speed if necessary.

text: Womit müssen Sie hier rechnen?

info:
In curves, extreme centrifugal forces can act at high speeds, which can result in a loss of vehicle control.

At intersections and junctions, high speed can result in long braking distances.

There is a risk that crossing pedestrians will be detected too late at pedestrian crossings.
text: Wo führt schnelles Fahren häufig zu Unfällen?

info:
At road narrowings, too high a speed could lead to a collision with oncoming traffic because the braking distance is too long. At level crossings, there is an increased risk of skidding due to tracks and possibly uneven road surfaces.

In blind corners, driving too fast can result in other motorists being seen too late.
text: Wo ist zu schnelles Fahren besonders gefährlich?

info:

The same applies to acceleration in the curve, which is why you should only accelerate at the transition to a straight part of the road.

info: Anyone who is being overtaken must not increase the speed of his or her vehicle. This would prolong the overtaking distance of the other vehicle and lead to unnecessary danger. Other hazards, such as pulling out, are also not permitted.

info:
If the person caught up with suddenly accelerates, the overtaking procedure must be stopped. The overtaking manoeuvre must also be stopped in the event of sudden oncoming traffic.

Overtaking is only allowed if you can ensure that any oncoming traffic will not be obstructed during the entire time that you are overtaking. Furthermore, overtaking is only allowed if the driver is driving at a significantly higher speed than the person who is to be overtaken.

Anyone who is overtaken must not increase his or her speed.

info: While driving in a tunnel, oncoming traffic lighting and reflections are often perceived more intensively, which can impair attention. The longer the tunnel, the more monotonous the ride may appear. This can lead to a faster loss of attention.

asw_2: Durch Alkohol und andere berauschende Mittel
info: Certain drugs have an effect on sensory perception and can thus reduce the ability to drive. The possible consequences of fatigue are often underestimated and can also affect the ability to drive. Alcohol and other drugs can impair your driving ability.
text: Wodurch kann die Fahrtüchtigkeit herabgesetzt werden?

info: The level of alcohol in the body can be reduced by approx. 0.1 per mille per hour. Thus, the breakdown of 1.0 per mille takes about ten hours.

info: Even in small quantities, alcohol can have significant effects. It can impair vision and hearing. It can also affect the ability to react. There is also a risk that it may encourage risky driving.

asw_3: Anhaltende Verbesserung der körperlichen und geistigen Leistungsfähigkeit
info: Certain drugs can induce intoxication, which in turn can affect sensory perception. There is also a risk of becoming addicted to certain drugs.

info: Even the use of LSD, marijuana, hashish, heroin, cocaine, or amphetamines on a single occasion may cause temporary inability to drive.

info: In contrast to alcohol, THC, which is the active ingredient contained in hashish, is not broken down evenly. This means that the time required for breakdown cannot be estimated.

info: Driving under the influence of drugs can be punished in different ways. A driving ban or a withdrawal of the driving licence is a possible consequence. A fine or even imprisonment may be a consequence. The arrangement of a medical-psychological examination (MPU) is possible.

info: The possible consequences of consuming hashish are manifold. Among other things, there is a risk of a restriction of sensory perception, including reduced responsiveness. info:
Anyone driving a vehicle may not cross the undivided line partially. If it delimits a paved side strip, agricultural tractors and machinery, carts and similar slow vehicles outside of built-up areas must drive as far to the right of it as possible.

Any person driving a vehicle should not stop on the left of the undivided line if there is a hard shoulder or special lane on the right.

info: Moisture and slipperiness result in reduced traction and thus increase braking distance. On a slope, the car accelerates due to the downforce of the slope, which extends the braking distance. A trailer increases the mass of the vehicle, which results in a longer braking distance with the same braking force.
text: Was verlängert den Bremsweg?

info: The condition of a braking system influences the braking distance. New brakes with good discs and full brake pads work best. The road surface has a large influence. For example, slipperiness can significantly increase braking distance. The type of tyres and tread depth influence the braking distance.
text: Wovon ist der Bremsweg abhängig?

info: Unless there are other restrictions, a maximum speed of 50 km/h applies to all motor vehicles in built-up areas.
text: Welche zulässige Höchstgeschwindigkeit gilt allgemein innerhalb geschlossener Ortschaften?

info: A doubling of the speed results in a quadrupling of the braking distance. The rule of thumb for braking distance is as follows: (speed / 10) x (speed / 10).
text: Sie verdoppeln Ihre Geschwindigkeit. Wie verändert sich der Bremsweg?

info: Anyone driving a vehicle may only drive as fast as allows the vehicle to be constantly controlled. The speed should be adapted to road, traffic, visibility and weather conditions as well as to personal ability and characteristics of the vehicle and load.
text: Was müssen Sie bei der Wahl Ihrer Geschwindigkeit berücksichtigen?

info:
The average reaction time of a human being is 1 second. The distance covered by a vehicle in one second is therefore the "reaction distance".

The rule of thumb for the calculation is as follows:

Reaction distance = (speed / 10) x 3.
text: Nach welcher Faustformel kann man aus der Geschwindigkeit den Weg in Metern ermitteln, den ein Fahrzeug in einer Sekunde zurücklegt?

info: The rule of thumb for braking distance is as follows: (speed in km/h / 10) x (speed in km/h / 10).
text: Nach welcher Faustformel kann man aus der Geschwindigkeit den Bremsweg in Metern bei einer normalen Bremsung berechnen?

info: The braking distance is increased by the driving speed squared. Therefore, a doubling of the speed results in a quadrupling of the braking distance. The rule of thumb for stopping distance is as follows: (speed in km/h / 10) x (speed in km/h / 10) Stopping distance = (60/10) x (60/10) = 36 m.
text: Sie fahren mit 30 km/h. Dabei beträgt der Bremsweg bei einer normalen Bremsung 9 Meter nach der Faustformel. Wie lang ist der Bremsweg unter gleichen Bedingungen bei 60 km/h?

info: As a rule, the distance to a vehicle in front must be such that it can be retained even if the vehicle in front brakes suddenly. Poor visibility, high speed and poor (e.g., wet) road conditions have a direct influence on reaction distance, stopping distance and braking distance.

info:
The type approval is the permission from an authority to operate motor vehicles and their equipment.It may expire if one of the following three points applies:

  • the vehicle type approved in the type-approval is modified,
  • a danger to road users is to be expected
  • the exhaust or noise behaviour deteriorates.

The installation of an engine with a different power output can lead to the expiration of the type approval. The same applies to the installation of a fairing.
